bibl.title: Letter from Charles H. Coles to Philip Showalter Hench, February 9, 1942

div1.p: Coles informs Hench that he can find no information on the painting of Camp Lazear.

div1.head: Letter from Charles H. Coles to Philip Showalter Hench, February 9, 1942
div1.opener:
IN RE
CABLE ADDRESS “MUSEOLOGY NEW YORK”
THE AMERICAN MUSEUM OF NATURAL HISTORY
CENTRAL PARK WEST AT 79TH STREET
NEW YORK. N. Y.
February 9, 1942
DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION
CHARLES RUSSELL, PH.D., CURATOR
GRACE FISHER RAMSEY, PH.D., ASSOCIATE CURATOR
WILLIAM H. CARR, ASSISTANT CURATOR (OUTDOOR EDUCATION)
JOHN R. SAUNDERS, ILA., ASSISTANT CURATOR
HERMAN A. SIEVERS, STAFF ASSISTANT
FARIDA A. WILEY, STAFF ASSISTANT
WILLIAM LORD SMITH, M. D., STAFF ASSISTANT
GEORGINE MASTIN, STAFF ASSISTANT
HAZEL L. MULLER, B.A., STAFF ASSISTANT
Dr. Philip S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
Dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
We have sent you all the information we can
find about the painting, “Camp Lazear.” We do not have
it here in the Museum, the Explorers Club does not have
it and in general no one seems to know where it is.
div1.closer:
Yours very truly, Charles H. Coles
Chief of Photographic
